author: Miles J. Herszenhorn
description: The Trump administration urged a federal judge in Boston to pause its legal fight with Harvard University over more than $2 billion in research funding, citing the US government funding impasse.
title: Harvard Funding Case Should Be Delayed Amid Shutdown, US Says

author: Augusta Saraiva, Eric Martin, Kate Sullivan
description: Brazil and the US are working to arrange an in-person meeting between Presidents Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and Donald Trump, with a potential encounter likely to take place in a third country, according to multiple Brazilian officials familiar with the situation.
title: Brazil Sees Asia Summit as Ideal Spot for Lula-Trump Meeting

author: Michael Nienaber, Andrea Palasciano, Samy Adghirni
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz lashed out at Viktor Orban during a meeting of European Union leaders in Copenhagen on Wednesday, accusing the Hungarian prime minister of derailing discussions on the bloc’s security needs.
title: Merz Rebukes Hungary’s Orban as EU Seeks Unity on Defense Plans

author: Catarina Saraiva
description: Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said a lack of official data while the US government is shut down will make it harder for central bankers to interpret the economy.
title: Chicago Fed President Says Lack of Data During Shutdown Is ‘Problematic’ For Central Bankers

author: Lucy White
description: The UK will no longer automatically allow refugees granted asylum to stay indefinitely or reunite with their families, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer seeks to curb the incentives for migrants crossing the English Channel.
title: Starmer to End Automatic Right for Refugees to Stay Indefinitely

author: Erin Ailworth
description: Soybean prices bounced back on Wednesday after US President Donald Trump said he would press Chinese President Xi Jinping to restart purchases of the crop when the two meet at the end of the month.
title: Trump’s Signal on China Trade Talks Lifts Soybean Prices

author: Ari Natter
description: The Trump administration is planning to cancel billions of dollars earmarked for hydrogen projects in California and the Pacific Northwest as part of its first tranche of funding cuts following the government shutdown, according to an administration official.
title: US to Cancel Billions for West Coast Hydrogen Hubs Amid Shutdown

author: Naomi Ng, Yang Yang, K Oanh Ha
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, we explore what Trump’s $100,000 H-1B visa fee means for Indian employees and the global workforce.
title: Indian Workers Face H-1B Crisis as Trump Unveils $100,000 Visa Fee

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: The Liberal Democratic Party picks a new leader as it struggles to restore its fortunes
title: The Party That Ruled Japan for Decades Is in Danger of Crumbling

author: Daniel Flatley, Nicolle Yapur
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s record as a powerful pacifier of unruly markets is now being put to the test in Argentina, where investors are questioning the value of his pledge of support last week for President Javier Milei.
title: Bessent’s Argentina Rescue Pledge Put to Test by Traders Attacking Peso

author: Suvashree Ghosh, Olga Kharif
description: Zach Witkoff would like to make the Trump family’s real estate portfolio available as tokens on blockchain, giving access to a wider pool of investors.
title: Witkoff’s Son Wants to Turn Trump Real Estate Into Crypto Tokens

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: Ominous images of anxious adults and children began flashing on streaming services and social media more than a week before Senate Democrats forced a government shutdown over their demands to renew expiring Obamacare insurance subsidies.
title: Insurers Spend Big to Save Obamacare Subsidies at Center of Shutdown Fight

author: Enda Curran
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the how the standoff over the government shutdown is playing out. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Plays Hardball on Shutdown With Plans to Fire Federal Workers

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Argentina’s government sold dollars in the spot market on Wednesday to stem a slump in the peso that is now in its third day, according to two people with direct knowledge of the matter.
title: Milei Government Sells Dollars Again as Peso Drops for Third Day

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: US President Donald Trump said he would confront Chinese President Xi Jinping over Beijing’s refusal to purchase American soybeans, a growing area of tension between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Trump Vows to Confront China Over Its Refusal to Buy US Soybeans

author: Arne Delfs
description: At Friedrich Merz’s clear-the-air coalition gathering on Tuesday, the atmosphere was so stuffy that one minister collapsed and was rushed to hospital.
title: Merz’s Coalition Delays Reform Push as Tensions Simmer

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump said on Aug. 25 that he had fired Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook “for cause” after she refused his demand to resign over a claim by a top administration official that she lied on mortgage applications. Cook, in turn, filed a lawsuit against Trump, arguing his attempt to remove her from the Federal Reserve Board was unlawful and violated the central bank’s independence. On Oct. 1, the US Supreme Court declined to allow Trump to immediately oust Cook, ruling she can rema
title: Where Does Trump’s Effort to Fire the Fed’s Lisa Cook Stand Now?

author: Erik Wasson
description: Government shutdowns have become a recurring feature of US politics, the product of partisan standoffs over spending that force federal agencies to halt a wide range of services. The latest shutdown — the third under President Donald Trump across his two terms — began at midnight on Oct. 1, when Congress failed to pass a stopgap funding measure, triggering the nation’s first government closure in almost seven years.
title: Another US Government Shutdown Is Here. Why It Keeps Happening

author: Jim Wyss
description: Just hours after the Trump administration pushed an international “gang suppression force” through the United Nations to stabilize Haiti, US lawmakers gutted the country’s last stable industry.
title: US Shutdown Hobbles Haiti’s Textile Industry Amid Stabilization Push

author: Zoe Tillman
description: High-profile legal fights challenging Trump administration policies are being paused amid the US government funding impasse.
title: Trump Policy Fights Face Court Delays With Government Shutdown

author: Mark Chediak, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration told a federal court it intends to reconsider a key US government approval that authorized the construction of Equinor ASA’s planned second phase of an offshore wind project near New York and New Jersey.
title: Trump Plans Review of Equinor’s Empire Wind 2 Near New York

author: Souhail Karam
description: Morocco said almost 300 police officers and civilians were injured in the latest night of youth-led protests against failing government services and lavish spending for the 2030 men’s football World Cup.
title: Morocco Says Hundreds Hurt in Latest Wave of Gen Z Protests

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia may nationalize and swiftly sell off foreign-owned assets under a new privatization mechanism in retaliation for any European moves to seize Russian holdings abroad, according to a person close to the government.
title: Russia Drafts Plan to Seize Assets If EU Acts on Funds

author: Benjamin Stupples
description: The head of Goldman Sachs Group Inc.‘s charitable arm has warned of the challenges the philanthropic world is facing from US President Donald Trump‘s efforts to curb programs that don’t align with his policies.
title: Goldman Philanthropy Boss Says It’s ‘Tough Time’ for Nonprofits

author: Zoe Tillman, Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court refused to allow President Donald Trump to immediately oust Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook while she sues to keep her job, dealing a setback to his efforts to exert more control over the central bank.
title: Supreme Court Refuses to Let Trump Immediately Oust Fed’s Cook

author: Michelle Kaske, Sri Taylor, Laura Nahmias, Gregory Korte
description: The White House is halting $18 billion in New York infrastructure funding due to concerns over diversity and inclusion practices and as the first day of a federal shutdown grinds government work to a halt.
title: US Halts $18 Billion NYC Infrastructure Funds as Shutdown Hits

author: Bob Van Voris
description: New York state sued the Trump administration to restore $33.9 million in anti-terrorism security funds for mass transit that were blocked because of the state’s immigration sanctuary policies.
title: New York Sues to Restore Anti-Terrorism Funds Blocked by Trump

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy’s budget deficit will match the European Union’s 3%-of-output ceiling already this year, according to people familiar with the latest draft of the country’s finance plan.
title: Italy Budget Draft Puts Deficit at EU’s 3% Limit Already in 2025

author: Katanga Johnson, Kate Sullivan
description: Travis Hill, the acting chair of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., was nominated this week by President Donald Trump to helm the key US bank regulator.
title: Trump Nominates Travis Hill to Be Chair of Key US Bank Regulator

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: A temporary surge in farm-export dollars has prompted Argentines to purchase cheap greenbacks, draining the very reserves President Javier Milei’s government is trying to rebuild.
title: Currency Arbitrage Costs Milei $2 Billion a Month in Argentina

author: Sam Dagher
description: Arab and Muslim national leaders are pushing Hamas to accept the Gaza plan unveiled by US President Donald Trump this week, saying the need to end the fighting surpasses concern about the finer details.
title: Arab and Muslim States Push Hamas to Accept Trump’s Gaza Plan

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The prime minister used his party conference speech to attack the Reform UK leader. Nigel Farage is still dictating the terms of their contest.
title: UK’s Starmer Has Farage to Thank for Labour’s New-Found Grit

author: Daniel Hornak
description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico won’t attend an informal meeting of European Union leaders in Copenhagen due to health issues related to an attempt to kill him last year.
title: Slovak Leader Skips EU Summit, Citing Post-Shooting Health Issue

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer was urged not to ape the policies of Nigel Farage’s right-wing Reform UK at a hustings for the Labour Party’s deputy leader contest that exposed its fragile unity.
title: Starmer’s Test From Left on Show in UK Labour Deputy Contest

author: Jim Wyss
description: Cuba, Venezuela and Nicaragua are once again being excluded from the Summit of the Americas, a regional meeting of leaders from across the hemisphere.
title: Cuba, Venezuela and Nicaragua Barred From Americas Summit

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Jamie Tarabay
description: Vice President JD Vance said Republicans don’t want to “lay anybody off” during the federal shutdown, insisting that Democrats would be held responsible for any negative consequences of the government closure.
title: Vance Downplays Layoffs While Johnson Urges Cuts in Shutdown

author: Elena Mejia, Joe Lovinger
description: For the full experience visit: Texas Redistricting Case Could Reshape House Balance After 2026 Midterms
title: Texas Redistricting Case Could Reshape House Balance After 2026 Midterms

author: Greg Ryan
description: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu is coasting to reelection after her main opponent quit the race, giving her a commanding mandate that’s putting city business leaders on edge.
title: Boston Mayor’s Blowout Victory Jilts CEOs Seeking New Direction

author: Laura Malsch
description: Munich closed down the Oktoberfest, Germany’s largest annual fair, for visitors until at least 5 p.m. local time due to a non-specific bomb threat, according to city officials.
title: Munich Shuts Oktoberfest for Security Checks After Bomb Threat

author: Alberto Nardelli, Michael Nienaber
description: Group of Seven nations are closing in on an agreement to significantly increase sanctions on Russia over its reluctance to end the war against Ukraine, according to a draft statement seen by Bloomberg.
title: G-7 Nears Agreement to Ramp-Up Sanctions on Russia’s Oil Revenue

author: Maggie Eastland
description: Semiconductor industry leaders are warning the Trump administration that a proposed tightening of visa rules risks shrinking a vital talent pool and undermining efforts to expand chip manufacturing in the US.
title: Trump’s Proposed Changes to Visa Rules Assailed by Chip Industry

author: Andrea Palasciano, Sanne Wass
description: European Union leaders are building momentum for a plan to provide Ukraine with €140 billion ($164 billion) in loans from immobilized Russian central bank assets at a summit in Denmark.
title: EU Presses Ahead on Unlocking €140 Billion From Russian Assets

author: Yian Lee
description: Washington denies any shift in stance, but US-Taiwan developments are tilting in Beijing’s favor.
title: Taiwan Suspects It Has a Trump Problem to Add to China

author: William Clowes, Michael J Kavanagh
description: A Congolese firm under US sanctions won a court ruling that may aid its claim to a prized tantalum deposit, potentially complicating Washington’s efforts to shore up supplies of critical minerals.
title: Congo Court Ruling Risks Snarling Trump’s Critical Mineral Goals

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union will restrict steel imports into the European market as local producers struggle with the impact of overcapacity coming from Asia and trade barriers from the US and other trading partners.
title: EU to Ramp-Up Tariffs on Steel Imports, Mirroring US Duties

author: Ted Mann, Shawn Donnan, Nazmul Ahasan, Michael Smith, Jessica Brice
description: Firms close to the administration have seen a surge in revenue as they advise businesses on how to avoid the import duties and play ‘Let’s Make a Deal’ in Trump's Washington
title: A Gunmaker’s Lobbying Shows How Trump’s Tariffs Changed the Game

author: Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s ruling coalition agreed on a bundle of reforms designed to streamline and digitalize administration and cut red tape that it said will save €16 billion ($18.8 billion) in bureaucracy costs.
title: German Red-Tape Drive to Slash €16 Billion From Cost Burden

author: Catherine Lucey
description: Hours into the US government shutdown, the standoff is already shaping up as a political quagmire for all involved.
title: Trump and Democrats Grapple for Edge in the Government Shutdown

author: Michael Cohen
description: Firebrand South African politician Julius Malema was found guilty of violating the nation’s gun laws for firing a weapon at a political rally in 2018.
title: South African Firebrand Malema Found Guilty of Breaking Gun Laws

author: Sommer Saadi, Merryn Somerset Webb
description: On Merryn Talks Money, Cavendish’s Roger Lee says Britain’s borrowing binge risks a bigger crisis.
title: Could a £200 Billion Deficit Bring Down the UK Government?

author: Fiona MacDonald
description: Members of Hamas’s political wing met officials from Qatar, Egypt, and Turkey in Doha on Tuesday as part of the militant group’s deliberations over a US peace plan for Gaza, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Hamas Said to Meet Qatar, Turkey Officials Over Trump Plan

author: David Alire Garcia
description: Mexico’s first woman president has turned her predecessor’s signature press event into her own.
title: How Claudia Sheinbaum Became Mexico’s Most Popular Streamer

author: Ruth Olurounbi
description: Nigeria’s economy has turned the corner after almost three years of reforms, with growth accelerating, inflation slowing and debt costs declining, President Bola Tinubu said.
title: Nigeria’s Reform ‘Pains’ Herald Start of New Era, President Says

author: Zahra Hirji, Lauren Rosenthal
description: From flood insurance to environmental grants, programs that support resiliency in the face of natural disasters are expected to be cut back.
title: US Government Shutdown Curtails Key Weather and Climate Programs

author: Dan Strumpf, Tooba Khan
description: Pakistan and the US are deepening cooperation in energy, mining and technology sectors, with Islamabad planning an investor conference in Washington later this month to draw American investment, Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb said.
title: Pakistan Seeks to Lure US Investment After Trump’s Pivot

author: Sakura Murakami
description: The chief of a small but influential Japanese political party said he wouldn’t immediately join a coalition with the ruling party after its new leader is elected on Saturday.
title: Key Japan Opposition Party Head Reluctant to Jump Into Coalition

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: The $550 billion investment fund into the US that’s a pillar of the US-Japan trade deal won’t affect currency markets, according to Japan’s top trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa.
title: Trump’s $550 Billion Demand Won’t Weaken Yen, Akazawa Says

author: Gregory Korte, Adrienne Tong
description: The US government is shutting down, with agencies activating contingency plans that sideline hundreds of thousands of federal workers and halt a wide range of services.
title: How the US Government Shutdown Will Affect Key Agencies

author: Michael Cohen
description: A US accord that grants more than 1,800 products from 32 African nations duty-free access to the world’s biggest market expired Tuesday night, halting a decades-old program aimed at promoting development and democracy on the continent.
title: US Duty-Free Trade Pact With Dozens of African Nations Expires

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: One of Canada’s most influential business groups says it supports Prime Minister Mark Carney’s plan to boost investment, but wants to see a credible fiscal plan in the upcoming budget.
title: Canada’s CEOs Hail Carney’s Investment Tilt, Warn on Rising Deficits

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis
description: Congress blew past a midnight funding deadline, triggering the US government’s first shutdown in nearly seven years — and the third under President Donald Trump.
title: US Begins Government Shutdown With Trump, Democrats at Impasse

author: Andrea Palasciano, Piotr Skolimowski, Aaron Eglitis
description: A rise in drone incursions into European airspace has prompted a rush among Western allies to build up their defenses. But the continent faces a multitude of challenges that will make it hard to mount a quick response.
title: Lacking Air Defense, Europe Races to Catch Up in Drone War

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan will get its second prime minister in just over a year when the ruling Liberal Democratic Party holds a leadership election on Oct. 4. If one of the two candidates leading the opinion polls wins, the country could have either its first female prime minister or its youngest leader since World War II.
title: Why Japan Is Getting Its Second Prime Minister in Just a Year

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: US retailers are appealing to Congress for a new law allowing them to round purchases to the nearest nickel as new supplies of pennies dry up, according to a letter seen by Bloomberg.
title: Retailers Seek Law Rounding to Nearest Nickel as Pennies Go Away

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile President Gabriel Boric said late on Tuesday that public spending will rise less in 2026 than in recent years, as his administration looks to recover credibility following back-to-back missed fiscal targets.
title: Chile’s Boric Proposes Small 2026 Spending Hike Amid Fiscal Woes

author: Laura Bliss
description: Sites were damaged when they remained open to the public during the last government shut down in 2018.
title: National Parks Told to Remain Open During Shutdown Despite Risks
